dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking a little

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max starts to sit:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad? He's . . . a liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) A liar? I don't think you mean "a liar."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... he wears a suit and goes to court and talks to the judge and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I see-- you mean he's a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLETCHER REID, early 30's, stands before the JUDGE. His manner is utterly genuine and convincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark street. . . a stormy night... two desperate men struggle... one man is taken to the hospital, the other to ja il. The prosecutor wants you to believe this is an open-and-shut case of a poor man, brutally victimized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods at the victim - - a fragile OLD MAN in his 70's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for once I agree with t he prosecutor. This is an open-and shut case -- but the true victim is my client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher's CLIENT is a 250 pound brute in a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put yourself in his shoes for a moment--walking home from church, alone, in a frightening part of the suburbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he describes his client's movements, Fletcher ACTS THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nervous, timid, looking over your shoulder -- when suddenly, you encounter him-- (pointing at the old man) pouncing from the shadows. You quiver in fear. The streetlight flashes on something shiny in his hand-- a knife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Fletcher becomes the attacker, brandishing a weapon. The jurors RECOIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in that terrifying instant you do what any respectable citizen would -- you defend y ou rse lf. Only after you shatter his arm and collarbone do you realize it's all a mistake... the man was merely walking away from an ATM machine, the apparent flash of metal caused by his bank card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reveals the weapon in his hand is only a credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you stand over his crumpled, though potentially still-dangerous form, your he art goes out to him. You want to help. First, you gather up the many bills he dropped, to stop them from bl owi ng away. Second, in an effort to get the name and number of someone to notify, you take his wallet. Finally, you leap into the man's Lexus to head for assistance, when suddenly a police car speeds up. You breathe a sigh of relief: "Someone to look -after the injured man! Oh joy!" But do the police applaud your initiative? Do they hail your heroism? No-- they arrest you and throw you in the slammer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks along the jury box:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В· And why? Why does the State turn its massive power against this individual? (takes an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moment, then answers his own

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discrimination, (to a black

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this time it's not based on race. (to a female

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not based on gender. (to a man wearing a crucifix) Not based on religion, (to a heavy set

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--this time it's discrimination based on size!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . I know what the prosecution wants you to think - - i t ' s always the big guy's fault. Is that what we've come to as a society -- persecuting people because they're large?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher points accusingly at the opposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame on you, Mister Prosecutor! Shame on you! (turning back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The state is trying to barbeque my client on the spit of Justice. Only you can douse the flames. The decision is your s. And please...don't let your emotions run away with y ou . The fact that my client is a family man, raising his sons alone after the tragic death of their mother, has absolutely no bearing on this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the front row we see two sad-faced YOUNG CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead, let cold reason be your guide as you decide the fate of this church-going, orphan-rasing widower!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher returns to his seat. Jurors, dab their eyes.

dialogues.text: Fletcher bounds down the stairs, passing a fellow LAWYER,

dialogues.text: How's it going, Fletcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he' s won) Another gratifying day serving Justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of my neighborhood after dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company wants me to get started right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't just pick up and move to Boston with two days notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ju st come check it out. You a nd Max, see the town. Let's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . pick out a place together. Then, if you want to turn me down and scar me for life, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just not that simple... What about my job? I've been at UCLA three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's New England. They're lousy with colleges. You can't swing a bat back there without hitting a college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd get a job there in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other factors involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T here they are now.       В·.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up in front of Fletcher's building where Fletch and Max are waiting. Fletcher's still reviewing a file. As Audrey gets out of Jerry's car, Max runs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have fun? How were the wrestling matches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big fun. Manly fun. Am I right, Maxie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fun..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Audrey) So how were the wrestling matches ? Did you have fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max , my man! My happy birthday man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Jerry exchange "fives" and'a hug.   Jerry gives M a light punch on the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-two-three-four-five... and one for good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that? He struck the child!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what dad got me! (shows the glove)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Great! I have my glove in the car. We'll stop in the park on the way home and play c atch. Then tonight we'll oil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it, wrap a rubber band around it. . . It'll be great. (to Fletcher) Great birthday present, dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher hates him.    Jerry and Max go to Jerry's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (makes a fist) When is it his birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some thing's come up. We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, let's go. I want to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fletcher) We'll talk tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh , yeah, right. Seven. I knew that. I did. I blocked it out weeks ago. The se ven tee nt h of May. Max's birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the eighteenth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seventeenth of May is the day I .remind myself that the eighteenth is Max's birthday. See you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, and Fletcher's new client, VIRGINIA COLE, an alluring woman in her early thirties/ review the document he spent the previousВ·night putting together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good. This is really smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only i t ' s . . . Like not true. Every word of it is a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher and Miranda exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... isn't that a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Cole, the only problem here is that after you've provided years of faithful service and loving support, of raising his children -- They are his?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H m ? Oh yeah. One for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all that, your husband wants to deny you a fair share of the marital assets based on one single act of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDISCRETION--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven single acts of indiscretion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Seven acts of indiscretion, only one of which he has any evidence of, and all of which he himself is responsible, for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Cole, I stayed up all night last night studying your c ase. Not just your case... b ut you. And, by now, I feel I know you. You are the victim here. The wife of a cold, distant businessman. Starved for affection, driven into the arms of another man-- VIRGINIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven. FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not missing a

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: --Seven .other men. You're not trying to deny him what is r ig htf ull y his. All you're insisting on is what is r ig htf ull y yours. And maybe an idgy-smidgy bit more. I think you're bending over backwards. VIRGINIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I did agree to give him j oint custody of the kids... (to Miranda) He's always been a good father. FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've always been a good wife. VIRGINIA (getting worked UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. . . FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's such a thing as being t oo nice. That's why you need aggr essive representation. To show the court that there is more than one side to this st ory. All I'm asking is the opportunity to see that justice is done on your behalf. (takes her hand) Will you give me that opportunity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares into her eyes. A moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I ' m tired of getting kicked around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Reid. I ' m so grateful I have an attorney I can trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S he gives him a HUG and momentarily grabs his ass. With farewell nod to Miranda, she leaves. Miranda turns, smiles at Fletcher, then shuts the door. She moves in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good. You're really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, pshaw. (pronounces it with the "p")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks a piece of lint off.his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N o, I mean it. The Cole case is worth a truckload of money to this firm, not to mention the press it's going to g en er at e . You win this case and I guarantee you'll make partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his tie) Actually, how would you like to make a partner right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his lapels and pulls him in for a deep KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PARTY in progress, KINDERGARTNERS being entertained by MAN in a clown suit and clown make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Fuzzy is my name, Making children happy is my game, With a shake and a juggle, And a big belt buckle, You'll all be glad I came. '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flops down on his back causing something in his pants HONK. Audrey and Jerry watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you don't hire your brother, who will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They called me again from B oston. They really want me there tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . . I can't go to Boston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll love it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't move Max three thousand miles away from his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey, I have never said a bad word about your ex --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how much responsibility does Fletcher take for Max, now? He'd never come over if you didn't remind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But if they're three thousand miles apart they'll never see each other. Fletcher will never come to Boston and how can I send Max cross-country to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So because your ex-husband is unreliable, we can't-'-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's not logical, it's emotional. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still want to marry you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry picks up the PHONE, pulls out a piece of paper, dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mr. Crisitelli, Jerry She!ton... I hope I'm not calling too late... Mr. Crisitelli, I'm afraid I have to turn down your offer..'. So am I . . . Well, I've fallen in love with this beautiful woman in L.A. and she doesn't want to leave and I won't leave without her... Well, thank you very much... Yes, good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hangs up) He wasn't there, but that's 1   the speech I would've made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and KISSES him.             The PHONE RINGS. answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, where are you? We're getting ready to cut the cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urn, actually, something has come up. A problem on a new caaa--                .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda bites one of Fletcher's nipples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-h-h-h-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just nailed my В·knee into the desk... Listen, I'm really sorry I can't 'make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is going to be so disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to him, I promise. I'll pick him up from school tomorrow, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to put him on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda starts "reeling in" the phone cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no.     I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGRILY, she hangs up. Fletcher stares UNHAPPILY at the phone, before Miranda THROWS HIM BACK ONTO THE COUCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PAN DOWN from banners reading HAPPY BIRTHDAY, MAX!. . a room full of guests... to a desultory five-year-old. Audrey finishes lighting the candles on the homemade cake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, birthday boy, make a wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, honey. It can be anything-- whatever you want most in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he .doesn't respond, she leans down to him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, your dad is sorry. He had to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he was coming. He promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, he... promises he'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max doesn't believe it.     < He turns his full attention to the candles on the cake. VOICE OVER we hear what she does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish, for just one day, Dad couldn't tell a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a breath --and blows out all the candles. A strange WIND blows the drapes and the wisp of smoke up, u up... to the clock on the wall. It's 9:15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clock on a wall.   It's 9:15'. We are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN around Miranda's office, where the displaced sofa is adorned with Fletcher's shoes... To the credenza, where Fletcher's pants hang... To the lamp, where Fletcher's shorts swing... To the desk, where a ravished Miranda lies next to Fletcher. Superbly confident of the answer, she asks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S o . . . was it good for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without thinking, Fletcher responds in the most astonishi way possible-- he TELLS THE TRUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda turns to him in disbelief -- but it's nothing compared to the LOOK OF SHOCK on Fletcher's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens -- and the naked Fletcher is forcefully kicked out. He goes TUMBLING over a desk as a RAIN OF CLOTHES follow. The door SLAMS SHUT again, leaving him without his pants. A CLEANING LADY stares at him in shock, then takes her broom, aims for his crotch, SWINGS.and. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alarm CLOCK RINGS. Fletcher BOLTS UP in bed. With regret and wonder he remembers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I've had better?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher brushes his teeth, looks up at his reflection in the mirror, mouth foaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I've had better?!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed for work, Fletcher waits for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing it off) "I've had better?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I t arrives. He steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator is empty, except for Fletcher... and a beautiful young WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New in the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just moved in Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Well, you must allow me to give you the grand tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O h? Do you do that for all the new tenants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just the ones I want to bang like a drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher's face REGISTERS extreme SHOCK and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR a SMACK off camera and a PING as the elevator doo opens. The model storms off and A STUNNED Fletcher steps out, rubbing his freshly slapped face.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. COURTROOM -, MORNING
dialogues.text: A SHAKY Fletcher strides toward the courthouse... when he is accosted by a BEGGAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any change, Mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you spare some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unquestionably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher walks faster, PUZZLED that he has answered truthfully. The beggar is even more puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I resent your p re sen ce. You fill me with an unpleasant mixture of disgust and guilt. Further, I don't believe you'll use the money for food, but I believe you'll use it for, at worst, drugs, or, at best, whiskey, or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . cigarettes. Also, I'm cheap. As Fletcher heads up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerkoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A winded Fletcher joins Virginia at the respondent's tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you're having a rough morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He WINCES as he recognizes the words. Then, an extremely wealthy, respectable industrialist, RICHARD COLE enters with his attorney, DANA APPLETON, young, brisk, confident

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana.         "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Virginia, how much will it take to put an end to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty per cent of your estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is SHOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty per cent? With a pre- nup and proof of adultery? What's your case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our case is simply this. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher opens his mouth to enlighten her -- but he CAN'T GET THE WORDS OUT. He tries to FORCE OUT SOUNDS, but succeeds only in looking like a fish gasping on dry land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting, though based on your track record, I expected a little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearing panic, Fletcher whirls to his BRIEFCASE and grabs the brief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wa it! Wait!    I've got it in writing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when Dana tries to take the document, the astonished Fletcher finds himself PHYSICALLY UNABLE TO RELEASE IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He INVOLUNTARILY snatches the document away and IT PULLS HIM to a nearby TRASH CAN where he throws it out. At this moment the BAILIFF calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rise for the Honorable Judge William Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny, Fletcher. You want to play hardball, I'm game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDGE STEVENS takes the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling case BA 09395, Richard Cole versus Virginia Cole. How're we doing this morning, counsel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, Mr. Reid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm a little upset about a bad sexual episode I had last night--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher screeches to a standstill, suddenly aware of wha he just said. After an awkward silence--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're still young. It'll happen more and more. In the meantime, what do you say we get. down to business? First, Mr. Reid, I see that your client was previously represented by Mr. Rand of your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you're seeking to substitute in as counsel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine , fine. And for the record, the reason is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rand had severe ethical objections to my client's case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher is incredulous. Somehow his greatest asset in th world, his mouth, has become his worst enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you don't share the same ethical objections, Mr. Reid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have lower standards, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Well, if Mrs. Cole wants the substitution of counsel, I'll allow it. Is that what you want, Mrs. Cole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virginia looks to the judge, then to Fletcher, whose unorthodox syle seemed so brilliant earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside, to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (to judge, with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I ' d like a continuance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This case has already been delayed several times, Mr. Reid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that, Your Honor, but I ' d really, really, really like a continuance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to hear good cause, counselor. What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROOM begins to SPIN slowly -- then faster -- then faster -- until we wind up squarely on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commendable, Mr. Reid, but I'm still waiting for the good caus e. Now, do you have it or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . not? '            FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motion for a continuance denied. Is there any chance of a settlement in this case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, Your Honor. Mr. Reid made it abundantly clear that the last thing in the world he wanted was to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SETTLE! SETTLE! SETTLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana and Mr. Cole look at Fletcher with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There appears to have been a change in strategy. Let's go to my chambers and negotiate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BANGS the gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana and an apprehensive Fletcher sit before the judge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, under the terms of the prenuptual agreement, if Mrs. Cole commits adultery, she is entitled to nothing. We have in our possession an audiotape made by a licensed private investigator of an explicit act of sexual congress with a man who is not her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds pretty damning, Mr. Reid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It certainly does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, my client has no desire to see his ex-wife destitute. Against my advice, he's willing to offer her a cash settlement of.two point four million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two four seems like a pretty fair offer, Mr. Reid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastically fair. Phenominally fair. In fact, I'd say beyond fair, bordering on stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana fumes. The judge finds Fletcher's boldness refreshing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you suggesting, Mr. Rei d? That Ms. Appleton's willingness to proffer such an offer betrays a lack of faith in her position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (utterly sincere) No, not at all. She's got my client dead to rights. When

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: attorneys go to sleep at night, they dream of having a case as strong as hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can the sarcasm, Reid. All right, I admit it -- I've seen you make even the lamest case fly. But this time I have you. Even Clarence Darrow couldn't explain this away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brandishes the audiotape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wel l, Mr. Reid? without a dynamite explanation, I'd say you're dead in the water. How's you client's story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best that money can buy, Y o u r Honor.       В·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong corroborating evidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have evidence that you are not going to-believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite herself, Dana is beginning to look worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty confident how this trial is going to come out, eh, Mr. Reid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeless) . "Confident" is too weak a word, Your Honor. I am certain what will happen if I take this puppy to trial. The verdict will be a stunning, humiliating defeat that will cut a spectacularly promising legal career off at the knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher is referring to himself, of course, but Dana thinks he's speaking about her. She buckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! Double the offer! Four point eight! And not a penny more. (venomous, to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms out, leaving an astounded Fletcher behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are some negotiator, Mr. Reid. If your client has half a brain, she'll jump at the offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher has joined Virginia at the respondent's table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? ! Mrs. Cole, this offer was a miracle. I'm talking about a walking-on-water, Lazarus-rising-from-the-dead, FIND-NO-LINE-AT-THE-FRIGGIN'- DMV miracle! You've gone from two point four to four point eight million in... (checks his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: four minutes. Think of it this way -- now you're getting paid seven hundred thou per schtupp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Reid, you convinced me yesterday -- I'm the victim here, starved for affection, driven into the arms of another man--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven!     В·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Seven other men. With the story you came up with, I don't think I can lose. I want to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Cole, you don't        В·. understand, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before Fletcher can finish, the judge enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well , Mr. Reid. Do we have a settlement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you spare some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unquestionably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beggar continues on. '               FLETCHER Alright, I get your point. But this is a crisis! Look, I'll give you ten bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beggar pulls out a quarter and holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so shiny and new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tw ent y.       .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minted in Denver.      Imagine that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-four. That's all I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment as the beggar thinks, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worth twice that to screw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERKOFF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAWYER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher turns, spots a familiar building in the distance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M y office!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts in the front door, when a SECURITY GUARD stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to use the phone to call a cab. I work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Allan has just exited the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to security

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, that man is tresspassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard starts toward Fletcher threateningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! (to Mr. Allan) I've got ten years worth of dirt on you and this firm, and I'm in the kind of mood today to get a lot off my chest. You let me use the phone or I start talking!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher's is THROWN ON HIS ASS in the street. Mr. Allan has watched from atop the stairs of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still euphoric, Reid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back inside.В· Fletcher starts to get up when a C SCREECHES to a HALT, inches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher! В·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's PHILIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty... It's Karaoke time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher runs up and HUGS the astonished man,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILIP!!   LOOK AT YOU!!! MY PHILIP!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher KISSES HIM ON THE LIPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip's driving Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saving my life, Philip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's funny, but for some reason I was beginning to think you didn't like me. Isn't that silly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not silly.       I don't like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like you. I'm sorry. I find you boring. I hate ch ara des . And you wouldn't know a good time if it sat on your face. (feels bad) I'm sorry. It was easier than telling you how I really felt. Are you upset?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. To be honest, I don't like you either. You treat people like obstacles and you cheat at charades. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you always trying to socialize with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a client. I figured if I didn't try to be your friend, you'd get a new accountant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip, I don't like you as a person, but I'm crazy about you as my accountant. I ' d never hire a new accountant. Never!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we don't have to like each other anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: . PHILIP
dialogues.text: All right. Sooner I get you В·to the airport, sooner I can dump your sorry ass off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip's car skids to a stop.    Fletcher jumps out. INT. LAX TERMINAL - DAY .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher races in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedelayed. Bedelayed. Fog, rain, something, anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the DEPARTURE BOARD " F li g ht 69. Departs 7:50. On Time. Gate 17." Fletcher looks at the clock -- It's 7:46!!   Holy Shit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher pushes his way HE a crowded escalator. Past people standing on the left despite the SIGN that says STAND ON RIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. . . excuse me. . . Come on folks, let's let the frantic man pass... Sorry... Thank... you... Standing on the right, passing on the left. They can't make this- deal any easier than it is... Come on... coming through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top,- a WOMAN in a NURSES UNIFORM asks for money..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help the poor?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speeding past) I don't trust you. I don't know what the hell that uniform is. Sorry. (a Hare Krishna tries to stop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOT NOW, TOGA BOY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunately, there's no line at the metal detector. Fletcher races right by but SETS OFF THE ALARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please step through again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!! !    Damn..;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher frantically tosses his keys, cufflinks, his Role into a tray. He tries again.     It BUZZES again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'tii practically naked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy in a TURBAN passes over him with a DETECTOR WAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a ZIPPER, Hodgy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wand BEEPS over Fletchers front pocket. He reaches in and pulls out the now familiar BLUE PEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher races by Gate 15, 16, gets to 1 7 . . . but sees PLANE Slowly TAXIING AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N ooo!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher spots a door marked "NOT AN EXIT".    Goes for i when a FLIGHT ATTENDANT interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!! ! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -NOTHING'S COMING!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman raises her eyebrows and looks anyway. And Fletcher BOLTS THROUGH THE EXIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scurries down a flight of stairs calling after the pla which is moving away. No way he'll catch it. Then, he sees a MECHANIC working on a MOBILE STAIRS UNIT (These are the steps they pull up to planes) Fletcher get an insane idea. . . The worker hears an ENGINE START, looks up to SEE FLETCHE in the truck, driving off, TOWING THE STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!!      Hey!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Fletcher's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher's DRIVING THE STAIRS trying to catch up with the plane. GROUND WORKERS react. Soon, the "stairs" are racing alongside the plane. Fletcher looks for signs of Audrey and Max but he's too l to see in the plane. He grabs the TOOL BOX'on the passenger's seat,-puts it on the accelerator, pinning it to the floor. Then, he CLIMBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "stairs" sway back and forth as he reaches the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PASSENGERS calmly read while outside FLETCHER speeds alon WAVING HIS ARMS like a maniac. The ENGINE NOISE drowns ou his call for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MA X ? !!   AUDREYY?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STEWARDESS stands in the aisle, giving the safety lecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case of a water landing, please use your seat cushion AS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В·Her MOUTH DROPS as she notices Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher is BANGING on the windows. People on the plane POINT, STARE in amazement. Fletcher looks ahead, SEES the stairs about to CRASH INTO THE WING! Fletcher desperately fiddles with some controls At the last second, finds the one that LOWERS THE STAIRS. He surfs under the wing... ...    and RAISES UP THE STAIRS at the other side. Fletcher's at the front of the plane, where he finally spots. . .

dialogues.speaker: MAX, AUDREY AND JERRY SEATED IN THE BULKHEAD
dialogues.text: Max has the window seat, Audrey arid Jerry are next to hi Audrey has on her headset and Jerry is looking for his seatbelt. NEITHER SEES FLETCHER. Fletcher SCREAMS to get their attention. But it's TOO NOISY. Then, Fletcher looks ahead and his EYES GO WIDE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUNWAY is ENDING!.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Max looks up...SEES HIS DAD. Audrey is now trying to help Jerry find his seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks under his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right here, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!   Mom!!               '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, it's dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W hat? What about dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey turns. Then she sees Fletcher WAVING weakly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher?!

dialogues.speaker: AT THAT INSTANT
dialogues.text: BUT THE STAIRS DON'T! They keeps going straight, heading right for the END OF THE RUNWAY and a parked LOADED LUGGA

dialogues.speaker: CART. . -
dialogues.text: And BAM!   FLETCHER, THE STAIRS, THE LUGGAGE ALL GO FLYIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey strains to watch as FLETCHER lands hard ONTO A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the strength he has he lifts his head, sees he's in one piece, and then COLLAPSES IN DEFEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher's BANGED UP pretty good. His head is BANDAGED. He.puts a COLD COMPRESS to his BRUISED FOREHEAD and WINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy, the truth hurts.   Yes indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Reid. Someone made bail for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher comes out LIMPING, totally dishevelled, missing shoe, and still holding the compress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up and is surprised to see AUDREY and JERRY waiting for him just outside the door. Max is sitting at the bottom of the stairs, still ANGRY. He sees his dad, then quickly turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Audrey and Jerry, trying to seem chipper) Sorry I made you miss your flight, not really. (no response) You're obviously a little

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . upset, not that I blame you... although I'll bet you'll still get the bonus miles. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, are you crazy? What were you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's two questions. A; Yes, but I think the legal term is temporarily insane. And B; I was trying to finally have that talk with you about Boston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey's patience are growing thin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... The whole truth and nothing but the truth, (with difficulty,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to stop the plane because it was taking off with my life... you and Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This comes as a surprise to Audrey. Not just what Fletche said, but the way he said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you've met somebody... somebody pretty great... and the truth is I wish you didn't but you did and... All I ' m asking i s . . . Please don't move to Boston. Please don't take Max away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's definitely moved by Fletcher, but not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come visit anytime. It's only a four hour flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to visit him. That's what I've been doing-- visiting him, dropping by, stopping in. I want to be in his life. I don't want to be some jerk that sees him at Easter. I want to be his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher turns to Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I have no right to ask, but can I talk you out of taki ng that job? I can get you a better job here in L.A. I've got all kinds of connect ions... what do you do again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I design security systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How symbolic. Okay great. You know Pac-Tec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biggest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of their systems shorted out and burned down a supermarket. I got them off. Another proud day for justice. If I ask them they'll beat your Boston offer in two s ec on ds .    ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put Jerry in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. (to Fletcher) Boston means this (snaps his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to me. All I want is for this lady and Max to be happy. Preferably, with me. Whatever they want, I'll go along with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look to Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want is for Max to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey looks over to Max seated at the bottom of the stairs. He's still upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better know your jury. You're hot exactly Max's hero today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me present my case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher walks over,, tries to be playful, starts WALKING TALKING LIKE THE TERMINATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been sent from the future to destroy you. . . Argghhh! (no response, a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max nods. Fletcher's at a loss for how to begin. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted me to stop lying. But lying isn't the problem. .. Why we lie ~ that's the problem. Sometimes we lie to make someone else feel better. But sometimes we lie because the truth gets in our way... (touches him) But being an adult means you sacrifice some things for more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: important things. Much more important things. I was so stupid, Max. (pointing to his own head) Malfunction in vector one. All this time you've been here and I could see you anytime I felt like it. And I... didn't. Please don't go to Boston. Max, I love you more than anything else in the world and you know it's true. I couldn't say it if it weren't true. Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment as Max studies his father, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Audrey) He's telling the truth, Mom. He's not allowed to lie. I made a wish and anything Dad says has to be the truth. (to Fletcher) .. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Fletcher's looking at his watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max. .. it's 9:22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, you made the wish at 9:15. I've been able to lie for the last seven minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max steps away from Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then, you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It wasn't a lie. I just wanted to be honest with you and tell you -- there was no wish to guarantee it anymore. You just have to believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks at Audrey, who is letting Max decide for himsel Max looks at Fletcher and tries to decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Audrey) Mommy... do we have to go to Boston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey looks at Jerry, then back at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.      We don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher hugs his son -- the kind of hug that says "I'll never let you go."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fletcher) Can we play catch tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher smiles. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful park with a basball diamond. Fletcher is seated on a bench, waiting. He's dressed in sweats, with baseball glove. Soon, Jerry, Audrey, and Max pull up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma x i mu m ! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher picks Max up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transformer!!! .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher and Max do the TRANSFORMER ROUTINE again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malfunction in vector seven. I have lost control of my affection reflex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher starts KISSING MAX on the head over and over. He sees Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Procreate!          Procreate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher... You're gonna lose a limb--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, dad, let's play catch!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sr. . . UE (starts to toss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, mom. (Max screams) Oh, you mean with a ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts Max down. Max runs into position. Fletcher stops for a second and turns to Jerry, man to man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take back every dirty, dishonest thing I ever said about you, wrote about you, faxed about you, E-mailed about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher tosses the baseball up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you up for a little friendly competition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you go play with your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't talking about basesball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slow smile from Jerry. Fletcher winks and tosses the ball to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Max) Alright, it's time to show you the old Fletcher Reid change up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher winds up in an EXAGERATED SUPER FAST MOTION, the instantly shifts to SUPER SLOW MOTION. Max CRACKS UP. Audrey LAUGHS. Jerry can't help but smile, too. There may be better things in life... but at this moment, it's hard to think of a single one. Honestly.
